data.title: Millikan, Robert Andrews, 1868
data.text:
Robert Andrews Millikan

Dates

March 22, 1868 – December 19, 1953

Authorized Form of Name

Millikan, Robert Andrews, 1868-1953

Additional Forms of Names

Millikan, R. A. (Robert Andrews), 1868-1953

Millikan, Robert, 1868-1953

Millikan, Robert A.

Biography

Abstract

Physicist (photoelectricity, ions) and eductor. On the physics faculty at University of Chicago (1896-1921); on the faculty at California Institute of Technology: director, Norman Bridge Laboratory of Physics and chairman of the Executive Council (1921-1946), emeritus professor of physics and chairman of the Board of Trustees, from 1946; Nobel Prize in physics (1923).

March 22, 1868Birth, Morrison (Ill.).

1891 – 1893Obtained AB and AM, Oberlin College, Oberlin (Ohio).

1895Obtained PhD in physics, Columbia University, New York (N.Y.).

1895 – 1896Post doctoral studies, Universities of Berlin and Gottingen.

1896 – 1921Assistant in Physics (1896-97), Associate in Physics (1897-99), Instructor in Physics (1899-1902), Assistant Professor of Physics (1902-07), Associate Professor of Physics (1907-10), and Professor of Physics (1910-21), University of Chicago, Chicago (Ill.).

1903 – 1919Associate Editor, Physical Review.

1915Elected member, National Academy of Sciences.

1916 – 1917President, American Physical Society (APS).

1916 – 1919Vice Chair (1917) and Executive Officer and Director of Research, National Research Council.

1917Chair, Physical Sciences Division, National Academy of Sciences.

1917 – 1919Chief, Science and Research Division, Signal Corps, United States Army.

1921 – 1945Director, Norman Bridge Laboratory of Physics, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena (Calif.).

1921 – 1953Chair, Executive Council (1921-45) and Emeritus Professor of Physics (1945-53), California Institute of Technology, Pasadena (Calif.).

1922Awarded Edison Medal, American Society for Engineering Education.

1923Awarded Nobel Prize in Physics.

1927 – 1953Member, Executive Committee Board, National Academy of Sciences.

1929President, American Association for the Advancement of Science.

1934Chair, Physical Sciences Division, National Academy of Sciences.

1945 – 1953Vice Chair, Board of Trustees, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena (Calif.).

December 19, 1953Death, San Marino (Calif.).

Occupation

Experimental and molecular physicist.

Places

Birth

Morrison (Ill.)

Undergraduate Education

Oberlin (Ohio)

Graduate Education

New York (N.Y.)

Employment

Chicago (Ill.)

Pasadena (Calif.)

Death

San Marino (Calif.)

Subjects

Atomic and molecular physics.

Cosmic rays.

Electrons.

Photoelectricity.

Physics -- Experiments.

Science -- Political aspects.

World War, 1914-1918.

Relationships

People

Family

Andrews, Mary Jane.

Mother.

Millikan, Clark Blanchard, 1903-1966

Son and both employed at California Institute of Technology.

Millikan, Glenn A.

Son.

Millikan, Greta

Wife, married in 1902.

Millikan, Max F.

Son.

Millikan, Silas F., 1834-1915

Father.

Advisors & Collaborators

Anderson, Carl D. (Carl David), 1905-1991

Advised by Millikan at California Institute of Technology, Space Distribution of X-Ray Photo-Electric Cells. Both also employed there.

Bitter, Francis, 1902-1967

Advised by Millikan at California Institute of Technology and both employed there.

Darrow, Karl K. (Karl Kelchner), 1891-

Advised by Millikan on his thesis concerning the measurement of the specific heat ratios of hydrogen.

Dempster, Arthur Jeffrey

Advised by Millikan at the University of Chicago and both employed there.

Evans, Robley Dunglison, 1907-

Advised by Millikan at California Institute of Technology.

Fletcher, Harvey, 1884-1981

Advised by Millikan at University of Chicago and worked together on oil drop experiment.

Gale, Henry Gordon, 1874-1942

Collaborated on a series of textbooks that were a mainstay of physics courses in the first half of the twentieth century.

Hale, George Ellery, 1868-1938

Close associate who helped Millikan go to the California Institute of Technology.

Haynes, Sherwood Kimball, 1910-1990

Advised by Millikan at California Institute of Technology.

Jesse, William Polk, 1891-1974

Advised by Millikan at the University of Chicago.

Lauritsen, Charles Christian, 1892-1968

Advised by Millikan at California Institute of Technology, "Electron emission from metals in intense electron fields," and both employed there.

Loeb, Leonard B. (Leonard Benedict), 1891-

Advised by Millikan at the University of Chicago in the mobility of gaseous ions in high electrical fields.

Loughridge, Donald Holt, 1899-

Advised by Millikan at Throop Polytechnic Institute (later California Institute of Technology).

Mann, Charles Riborg, 1869-1942

Co-wrote "The Theory of Optics," translated from the German.

Michelson, Albert A. (Albert Abraham), 1852-1931

PhD advisor at Columbia University.

Mills, John, 1880-1948

Co-wrote "Electricity, Sound, and Light."

Nernst, Walther, 1864-1941

Advisor at University of Gottingen.

Noyes, Arthur A. (Arthur Amos), 1866-1936

Close associate who helped Millikan go to the California Institute of Technology.

Pickering, W. H. (William Hayward), 1910-2004

Advised by Millikan at California Institute of Technology and collaborated on balloon-flight studies of cosmic rays.

Pupin, Michael, 1858-1935

PhD advisor at Columbia University.

Richter, Charles, 1900-1985

Advised by Millikan at California Institute of Technology.

Rood, Ogden N. (Ogden Nicholas), 1831-1902

PhD advisor at Columbia University.

Advised by Millikan at the University of Chicago.

Advised by Millikan at University of Chicago.

Co-wrote "A College Course in Physics."

Advised by Millikan at California Institute of Technology.
